citation.article-title: Sarcobium lyticum gen. nov., sp. nov., an obligate intracellular bacterial parasite of small free-living amoebae.

p.s: Description of Sarcobium lyticum sp. nov.
Sarcobium lyticum (ly' ti. cum. M. L. neut. adj. lyticum, that which causes lysis)
Type species of the genus Sarcobium.
The type strain of Sarcobium lyticum is strain L2T, which has been deposited in a two member culture with the Polish Culture Collection of Microorganisms as culture PCM 2298.

The description of the type strain is the same as that given above for the genus and species, and, in the absence of cultivation in pure culture, this description forms the nomenclatural type Rule 18a of the International Code of Nomenclature of Bacteria [19]).
